channel.title: Cool Shit on Home
channel.description: Recent content in Cool Shit on Home

item.title: Markdown Syntax Guide
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

item.title: Configuring CloudFront for Static Websites ‚òÅÔ∏è
item.description: üî• read the update wiki on the github wiki section This guide will help you configure CloudFront to serve your static website content with SSL support üîí. This can be necessary if you need to secure your website with HTTPS. We will cover the following steps: Creating an SSL certificate üìú Creating a CloudFront distribution üåè Updating Route 53 records üö¶ Prerequisites You should have an existing S3 bucket that serves your static website files.

item.title: Math Typesetting
item.description: Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

item.title: Tweemoji Support
item.description: Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways. In this theme, you can use Twemoji kit simply writing emoji and then adding this param in the config.toml file. twemoji = true More info in the theme wiki on Github.
